Search: id:a010687

%I A010687
%S A010687 1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,
%T A010687 1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,
%U A010687 1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6,1,6
%N A010687 Repeat (1,6): Period 2.
%C A010687 Continued fraction for (3+sqrt(15))/6. - _Philippe Deléham_, Sep 25 2006
%C A010687 This sequence can be generated by an infinite number of formulas all having the form a^(b*n) mod c subject to the following conditions. The number a can be congruent to either 3,5 or 6 mod 7. If a is congruent to 3 or 5 mod 7 then b can be any number of the form 3*k+6. If a is congruent to 6 mod 7 then b can be any number of the form 2k+1. Finally, if a is congruent to either 6, 26, or 31 mod 35 then c can be 7 or 35; otherwise, we use c = 7. For example: a(n) = 33^(15*n) mod 7, a(n) = 31^(9*n) mod 7, and a(n) = 31^(9*n) mod 35. - _Gary Detlefs_, May 19 2014
%F A010687 G.f.: (1+6*x)/(1-x^2). - _Philippe Deléham_, Sep 25 2006
%F A010687 a(n) = 5/2*(-1)^n+7/2. a(n) = 6*(n mod 2)+((n+1) mod 2). - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 20 2006
%F A010687 a(n) = 6^n mod 7. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 26 2009
%p A010687 A010687:=n->(6^n mod 7); seq(A010687(n), n=0..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 19 2014
%t A010687 Table[Mod[6^n, 7], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 19 2014 *)
%o A010687 (Sage) [power_mod(6,n,7)for n in xrange(0,100)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 26 2009
%K A010687 nonn
%O A010687 0,2
%A A010687 _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 11 1996
